Bedrock

The open source foundation for ground investigation data, subsurface modelling and Geo-BIM

üìñ Read / write Ground Investigation (GI) data in different formats

Data Format Read Write
AGS 3 ‚úÖ ‚ùå
AGS 4 Soon python-ags4

What do you need? DIGGS? NADAG? GEF? Something else?
Let us know by creating an issue or starting a discussion üí≠

Also, if you have a project with publicly available GI data, please share that in a discussion, such that we can create a tutorial from it ü§©

‚úÖ Validate your GI data

bedrock-gi comes with data validation to make sure that you can combine Ground Investigation data from multiple files into a single GIS database with consistent relationships between GI locations, samples, in-situ measurements and lab tests.

This data validation mechanism (based on pandera) is easily extensible, giving you the power to add your own data validation criteria üí™

üó∫Ô∏è Put your GI data from multiple files into a single 3D GIS database

For example, you can take GI data from 100 AGS files and combine them into a single a GeoPackage (like a Shapefile, but then waaay better). Such a GeoPackage can then be loaded into ArcGIS, such that you can visualize your GI data in 3D, and perform analyses:

üü¶ Put your GI data into Speckle

Once you have your GI data inside Speckle, it‚Äôs super easy to visualize GI data together with civil engineering designs:

Click here to go to the Kai Tak Speckle project from the left image

Moreover, your GI data becomes available in all the software that Speckle has connectors for.

üîì Free and Open Source Software

Free and Open Source Software (FOSS) gives you full access to the code, which means you can customize bedrock-gi to integrate with other tools and fit your workflows & project needs.

As the name implies, FOSS is free to use, so you‚Äôre not tied to expensive software licenses or locked into a specific software vendor ‚õìÔ∏è‚Äçüí•

You can give feedback and contribute, such that together we together can build the tools we‚Äôve always wanted and needed ü§ù


üí≠ Feedback

Got some feedback, a great idea, running into problems when working with Bedrock or just want to ask some questions?

Please feel free to:

  1. open an issue for feature requests or bug reports: bedrock-gi issues,
  2. start a discussion in this GitHub repo: Bedrock discussions,
  3. or start a discussion on the Speckle community forum if that‚Äôs more appropriate: Speckle community forum

All feedback and engagement with the Bedrock community is welcome ü§ó

üë∑ Contributing

Caution

Wait, please read this too!

Contributing isn‚Äôt scary üòÑ

Contributing isn‚Äôt just about writing code:

  • Use Bedrock and provide feedback ü™≤
  • Share how you use Bedrock üèóÔ∏è
  • Help each other out, e.g. by replying to questions in the discussions or bedrock-gi issues ü§ù
  • Spread the word about Bedrock ü§©
  • Documentation and tutorials üìÉ
  • Most pages on the bedrock.engineer website can be edited, so if you see a spelling mistake or have a suggestion on how to explain something better, please smash that button! üñ±Ô∏èüí•

  • If you would like to contribute code, AWESOME! üíñ
    Please create an issue for what you‚Äôd like to contribute. If you don‚Äôt know how to get started, please indicate this in your issue, and we‚Äôll help you out.
